text: Cabinet type (semi-recessed, surface-mounted, recessed) and gauge match submittals and architectural intent
Cabinet finish (metal, stainless steel, painted, aluminum) matches schedule and corridor aesthetics
Fire extinguisher type (typically 10 lb ABC) and UL/ULC rating match fire protection drawings
Location, mounting type, signage, and visibility comply with fire code & consultant drawings
Blocking or wall reinforcement installed for recessed/semi-recessed cabinets
Framing aligned and dimensioned to allow flush cabinet mounting
Fire rating of surrounding wall system maintained (cabinet rated or back box added if required)
Cabinet securely fastened, plumb, and level
Cabinet door swings open fully, operates without interference
Fire extinguisher securely mounted within cabinet using bracket or strap
Signage above cabinet mounted at visible height (typically 2100 mm AFF or as per AHJ)
Fire extinguisher tagged and certified by licensed fire protection contractor
Expiry date verified and unit free from dents, damage, or paint overspray
Cabinet glass/panel not cracked or scratched; no stickers blocking visibility
Reviewed by life safety consultant, building official, or fire department

id: • NBC / NFPA 10 / CSA B355, ULC S508, UL/ULC Rating Labels
• Local AHJ requirements (Fire Dept / Fire Commissioner)
